position.marginalia_text: Qui sit si venti pluuiaq[ue] similiter descendu[n]t, quod pluuia[e] non ferantur lateraliter [sub] Terram, veluti fera[n]tur venti, sed quod semp[er] ad [rectum] terra[e] cadunt. Qui sit [etu.] quod no[n] [ser..] stellar[um] motu vna [etu.] localite progred.t. pluua[e]!

marginalia.translation: What may be if the winds and rain fall down similarly, because the rain is brought laterally onto the earth, like the winds are carried, but because they always fall towards the right of the earth...

marginalia.anchor_text: Buxenpuluer das da kompt au&sharp-S; den Cauernis vnd Emunctorijs der Cataracten, der Vulcanischen Windtsterne

position.marginalia_text: Si ita ex stellaru[m] corporibus cu[m] Venti tum pluvia[e] descendant ad nos: quid [dice...] de stellis interpositis inter [...] ventos as vel [pluuioses] et nos. [s..] quod a ventis [...st..ijs] presenter, an non. Vel quid [dice...].

marginalia.translation: If thus both the winds and the rain fall down from the bodies of the stars towards us:

underline.text: Buxenpuluer das da kompt au&sharp-S; den Cauernis vnd Emunctorijs der Cataracten, der Vulcanischen Windtsterne
